attributes.action: Oil palm trees 20m hectares in rain forrests. 6b trees! 1 tree 80l of ho2 per d
attributes.additional_details: I lived on malaysia in 1997 when the m government allowed the deforrestation. Its criminal. Use google earth and see for yourself. East malaysia. 20 million hectares of oil palm plantations. 300 trees per hectare. 80 litres of water per day and i understand that is conservative. The numbers are  mind boogling. Thank you very much. For our childres  benefit.
attributes.background: To urgently review the harm to climate as a result of the proliferationnl of oil palm. Both in terms of water consumption and change to environment. 6 billion trees and increasing every year to produce this crop. It is a net user of water. Whereas before the rain forrest did just that produce rain.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may also be interested in signing this open petition:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/630305
Ban unsustainable palm oil products being sold in the UK
